lead_paragraph: KIGGEN--Edith Adams, a prominent music producer, died at Mt. Sinai Hospital on October 28, 2015. She died of advanced multiple sclerosis. Her career included working with such artists as Cab Calloway, Whitney Houston, Stevie Wonder and James Taylor. Mrs. Kiggen produced many events at Carnegie Hall, and the record "Swing Reunion," nominated for a Grammy in 1985. She was born in Pasadena, CA on January 19, 1936 to celebrated airline executive Alvin Adams and daughter of New York Governor Nathan Miller, Elizabeth Miller Adams. Edith Kiggen's brother, Ambassador Alvin Adams, Jr., died just two weeks earlier, on October 10, 2015. She is survived by her daughter Elizabeth Kiggen of New York City, brother Nathan Adams of Enis, MO, sister Helen Vollmer of Moraga, CA. 1/3
